Key Arguments: The bill creates two classes of citizens, giving more power to politicians, journalists, and educational institutions while silencing regular citizens.
Excessive fines and universal application of the code will lead to restrictive digital services and stifle freedom of speech.
Determining truth is challenging as information evolves, and the bill could lead to censorship of content that may later be proven true.
Including 'misleading' or 'deceptive' information, even if true, threatens freedom of speech and open dialogue.
Criticism from experts like Dr. Nick Coatsworth questions the bill's credibility and its alignment with truth-seeking.
Notable Quotes: It is disheartening to see that our Government does not respect our freedom of speech with the existence of this bill.
This classification threatens to silence the voices of regular people and undermines the democratic ideals that the internet has provided.
The task of accurately judging what is true or false is an impossible one.
Freedom of speech serves as a crucial cornerstone of open and honest dialogue, allowing room for people to be wrong, and for truth to be sought through debate and discussion.
